messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Library Suggestions
messages.msgSnippet: ... Nanci, Starting off with a unit studies approach would probably be a good start. Least offensive/stressful to the child and it keeps DSHS happy because
messages.messageBody:
Nanci and Thomas Kuykendall wrote:
>
> the catalogs can be kept as a
> >resource for other homeschoolers.
> >
> >Billy
>
> Hey! Can everyone throw some references my way? With looking at bringing a school age child home by the end of the summer, I am going to have to kick my but in gear as far as academics. With the fact that DSHS will be scrutinizing her progress and that she is coming from the PS Institutions I will probably need to begin more formally with her and ease into more Unschooling as she is ready and the system backs off.
>
> Nanci K.

Nanci,
Starting off with a unit studies approach would probably be a good
start.
Least offensive/stressful to the child and it keeps DSHS happy because
......... * it looks structured and full of routines*.
We started out this way our first year of hs'ing because our kids were
used to the PS way of doing things. Within a year we were starting to
become unschoolers.

Buzz
--
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
The Klement Family "Education is what survives when
Darryl, Debbie, what has been learned has been
Kathleen, Nathan & forgotten"
Samantha B.F. Skinner in "New Scientist".

messages.subject: RE:[Unschooling-dotcom] Library Suggestions
messages.msgSnippet: the catalogs can be kept as a ... Hey!  Can everyone throw some references my way?  With looking at bringing a school age child home by the end of the summer,
messages.messageBody:
the catalogs can be kept as a
>resource for other homeschoolers.
>
>Billy

Hey! Can everyone throw some references my way? With looking at bringing a school age child home by the end of the summer, I am going to have to kick my but in gear as far as academics. With the fact that DSHS will be scrutinizing her progress and that she is coming from the PS Institutions I will probably need to begin more formally with her and ease into more Unschooling as she is ready and the system backs off.

Nanci K.
